Documentation: Is the unique identification of a client.
Each outbound delivery has an unique identifier, the outbound delivery number. Outbound deliveries of different clients and system partners can however have the same delivery number.
Unique identification of a system partner (see SystemPartner).
Defines the different roles that partners for an outbound delivery can have.
Unique identification of a partner object.
Special designation of a company or the degree of a person.
Name of a company or a person.
Name of a company or a person.
Name of a company or a person.
Name of a company or a person.
Street and street (house) number or post office box.
It is part of the address.
The district of an address
Possible content: province, federal state, canton, area, county
The unique identifier for a country. ISO 3166-1 Alpha 2 Code.
ZIP code of the city origin.
Phone number.
Fax number.
An email address.
The address of the website.

The global location number (GLN), as well as the international location number, is used to identify the denotation of companies on an international level, including the address. It is a thirteen digit number comprising a three digit prefix EAN-country reference. The number is determined by the GS1 organisations.

Is the unique identifaction of a language, in compliance with ISO 639-2/B Alpha 3 Code. In case ISO specifies more than one code, the B-Code variant is used (ger instead of deu). If a particular language has regional differences, the 2-character country code according to ISO-3166 is used (eng-US, eng-UK, ger-CH, ger-AT, ger-DE).Info: ISO 639 is the set of international standards that lists short codes for language names.See also: LANGISOALPHA2ID.
Timezone value, for e.g. "Europe/Vienna".
